description:
In the role-play-based negotiation game Monumental Consequence, players take the roles of townsfolk of La Ville, whose church has been taken over by an invading army. Do you risk your lives to attack the church to save the art — or bomb it?

Similar to social deduction games, each player has a designated role, with victory conditions associated with it. Players negotiate and vote to settle on a decision. If the vote is inconclusive, a dice-rolling mechanism is used to complicate the scenario and start a new round. Play continues until one side has enough votes, then a final die roll determines the winner and the consequences of that choice.

Flip That House The Board Game takes its players through the journey of real estate investing, also known today as "house flipping".  The first "flipper" to acquire one million dollars in cash and property, is declared the Ultimate Flipping Mogul.

Flippers begin with $250,000 in cash and a flip.  The flipper that rolls the highest number on the dice begin play and then clock wise for the next flippers turn.  Flippers roll dice and move the appropriate spaces on the colorful and bright game board, following the action on the spot in which they landed.

This game will provide hours of fun and education for groups of all ages.

70 cards with puzzles in three difficulty stages that are to be solved using logic, fantasy and an eye for details. Points can be scored upon solving the puzzle depending on difficulty, and some extra points when answering a surprise extra question regarding details in the picture. Solution and explanation are provided on the back of the picture cards. Every card is a single puzzle only.

Description from the publisher:
"Lösen Sie knifflige Bilderrätsel. Allein mit Logik und Fantasie." ("Solve challenging picture puzzles with logic and fantasy alone.")

For many centuries there was peace in the four great kingdoms and life in the lands was simple and carefree. One day, however, unfriendly and warlike tribes appeared from the lands beyond the horizon and brought danger to the four kingdoms. The four rulers decided together to protect the people from the evil invaders and bring them into the cities. However, because the cities were too small and unsafe, they were first to be enlarged and expanded. Defensive towers, churches and a city wall were to be built around the stately palace, which was also to be newly erected. And so the great builders of the world were commissioned to plan and implement the buildings for the kingdom of the mountain lands in the north, the kingdom of the sun in the east, the desert kingdom in the south and the kingdom of the forest peoples in the west. In order to get all this done in time before a possible attack by the enemy tribes, the builders gather people from all walks of life - from peasants to princes - to help and cooperate from the lands. Each person is given his or her task, which must be completed exactly according to plan and order.

You and your fellow players slip into the role of these master builders. Everyone tries to place all their cards with the helping citizens on the building sites before all the other players. Act wisely and strategically as a master builder and you may become the greatest master builder of the four kingdoms...

—description from the publisher (translated)

Everything that makes the German language appealing is celebrated in this high-quality equipped quiz box! Lovers of language and literature can look forward to a variety of exciting questions and equally instructive and enlightening answers.

The knights do their best to climb to the top of the castle, while taking care of flying seagulls, dragons and the daring knights of their opponents. Everyone wants to escape from the castle's scary dungeon! Which strategy do you choose - to focus on fast climbing to the top of the castle, or do you have time to stop to stop the competing knights with sweeping tricks? The player with the first knight who reaches the top of the castle wins the game.

Players take turns playing cards to get their knights to the top.

This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information.

This edition contains 150 surprising and curious questions about cities, countries, rivers, beaches, buildings, sights, national parks and other geographical facts. Amusement and amazement guaranteed!

The title translates to "city, country, quiz".

Which ingredients belong in a tiramisu? Or which countries have the highest per head cheese consumption? There are eight possible answers to each question, but only four of them are correct. Everyone plays the game as a team. Who has the right knowledge and finds 4 out of eight?

Deadly football goals, human stew in the Jacuzzi, exotic delicacies that bite back without further ado: incomprehensible accidents, catastrophic coincidences and dramatic passing ...
The Grim Reaper is never at a loss for ideas when it comes to decimating his flock. And reality still invents the darkest stories!

How to play:
The card set contains 50 tricky, pitch-black puzzle cards for teens and adults to solve by asking clever questions. Cracking black stories together with friends is the most fun. One player, the bidder, takes a card from the deck, reads the short story written on the front of the card. On the back of the card, the master finds the answer, which he of course keeps to himself. Now the guessing people have to "ask" themselves the solution to the story. The questions should be formulated in such a way that the master can answer "yes" or "no". A spooky and fun guessing game for small and large groups - can also be played digitally.

A roll&write game about survival on a deserted tropical island.
The game is designed for 1 to 4 players, age 8+ with an average game time is 20-30 minutes.

In each turn, the active player rolls 4 D6 dice and performs actions using the dice pool. The goal of the game is to perform the scenario. For example: escape from the island, survive a certain number of days, find all the treasures.

The biggest obstacle during the game is constantly decreasing level of food and water, when they run out the player starts losing health and can die. It is also possible to die at the hands of another player and various dangers on the island.

The game continues until the scenario is completed or all players die.

Game published in 'Print&Play' format first.

You're good at keeping your Fingerlings on your finger, but can you keep them from falling out of the tree in the new Fingerlings Treetop Fall Game?

This is a classic skill-and-action game where players take turns pulling branches out of the tree without letting any of the monkey pieces inside the tree fall out. You've got to spin the spinner to find out what color branch you should remove, or maybe you'll get lucky and spin the skip space so you don't have to remove any branch that turn. If any monkeys fall to the bottom of the tree on your turn, you keep them. Once all the monkeys have fallen out of the tree, the game ends and the player with the fewest monkeys wins.

In this narrative adventure game, players must work together as they slog through cities, wilderness, dungeons and caves. However, watch out for the hidden agendas of fellow players. The characters that survive the game can come back in the next adventure and you can even string together a whole series of scenarios. There is even the option to write new screenplays yourself. The future is uncertain!

Absolutely Stonkers! is an easy to learn strategic card game that was born out of the 2021 meme stock mania which took the world by storm. The game is fast-paced, funny, and has two ways to win.

Players draw and discard cards to collect stocks and stopother players from colleecting them. Be the first to collect a Stonk (stock) card from each of the seven industries or the last one standing after all the other players have been indicted by the SEC to win. There are plenty of ways to sabotage other players and evade the SEC while on the way to become a Stonk Titan.

A long time ago, 4 extraordinary creatures lived among us: the pandastics 4!
But one day, to protect the 3 others, the 4th creature disappeared... Many adventurers went in search of it and it is said that to make it reappear, you must accomplish quests engraved in the ruins of an ancient temple...
During your adventure, it is up to you to be the most observant, attentive and clever to succeed in these legendary quests!
At the end of the road, you may discover this mythical creature that is just waiting to reappear: the Pand4stic!

Complete quests to solve the mystery of the Pandastic 4:
Turn your cards over wisely, using your memory to combine the characteristics of your cards!
But stop in time so you don't lose everything and score more points than your opponents!

Memory, risk-taking and daring will be essential for you to become the best adventurer and discover the Pand4stic!

—description from the publisher

The successful mystery series "Black Stories" is also available in the "scary-free" version - for families with children from 8 years old. Instead of dark and scary it gets colorful and funny at the "Black Stories Junior".

Black Stories Junior: horse stories includes fifty cards with riddles for you to puzzle out.

In these horse-powered riddles about fake coat colours, spooky ghost horses, exploding dung heaps, botched riding holidays or ponies in mortal danger, you have to combine things smartly and think cleverly around corners to uncover their secrets.

Tongue twisters are a real challenge - and quite funny for the listeners. The faster you speak these sentences, the greater the possibility of slurring your words.

How to play:

     You pick a card and repeat the tongue twister three times.
     Does it work without mistakes? You get to keep the card.
     Does it not work? The next person tries to repeat the tongue twister three times.
     The person who has collected the most cards wins.

IT Startup - Office Lockdown is a stand-alone expansion to "IT Startup - The Card Game". It contains 50% more components than the older "IT Startup - The Card Game" base game from 2020. It is playable for 1-6 players (standard game mode with a shared deck), with additional 2 vs 2, custom deck, solo and tournament modes. Aside from being a stand-alone game it can also be combined with previous game editions.

It had to end eventually! Humanity has finally become extinct. Just the Tanuki survived.

These legendary Japanese creates have all the random leftover stuff from people in the bin and have only picked up a few memorabilia. The hottest boards in the world! They surf as much as possible. Infinite space, free beaches and the big surf battle every weekend, when the waves hit first and then glow. Everyone catches a huge wave here. Which brings us to the topic. This game is like life. In the end, the one who gets their shit together wins. Get as many cards as possible in the correct sequence resulting in the longest wave — and on it the winner surfs away.

—description from the rulebook

Each turn, players draw a card with a value from one to twenty from the central pile of cards. Then, they add it their own row of cards. The goal is to arrange your cards in ascending order, but after you've placed a card in your row, it is turned face-down, and you'll need to remember where you put each card.

The game ends when the pile of cards runs out. The player that has created the longest sequence of ascending cards wins the game.

—user summary

Blood Coven is a microgame for 2-3 players, in which players are vampires competing to create a coven of vampies and a herd of victims to feed on. Blood coven features mechanics from the vampire game from Cults & Covens.

This is a microgame that uses pocket change as pieces. 10 pennies, 6 nickels. and 6 dimes. Coins in supply and city(play area) are "villagers". Coins in a players hand or fatigue area are "victims" and coins on turn order slots on the player card are "vampires'.

Each round is divided into 3 phases (feed, action, refresh). Players use pieces from their hands (victims) to feed any hungry vampires on their player cards and take actions. If any hungry vampires are not fed, they die. The game ends when there are no villagers left in the village or supply area.

The player with the most victory points wins. Players receive 1vp per victim in their possession. Vampires are worth 3vp for penny vampires, 4vp for nickel vampires, 5vp for dime vampires.

Blood Coven, WereKittens, and Eldritch Cults are 3 completely different microgames in the world of Cults & Covens. Each game can be played by itself or the games can be mixed so that players can play vampire against cat or even cat and vampire against a god from Eldritch Cults.

Eldritch Cults is a microgame for 2-3 players, in which players are weird and Lovecraftian gods who are competing to lure villagers into their cults. this game features mechanics from the cult game Cults & Covens.

This is a microgame that uses pocket change as pieces. 10 pennies, 6 nickels. and 6 dimes. Coins in supply and the city (play area) are "villagers". Coins that are tails up or in the fatigue area are cultists, heads-up coins are priests.

Each round is divided into 3 phases (place cultists, action, fatigue). 
In phase 1, players place cultists on temples to enable actions.

in phase 2, temples can take actions. Temples, on their turn can either turn a villager into a cultist or a priest.

in phase 3, players take back any cultists that were fatigued on the previous turn, then move any cultists they used this turn into the fatigue area.

Game ends when there are no coins left in the supply area or village.

The player with the most victory points wins. Players receive 1vp per cultist in their possession. Priests are worth 4vp for penny priests, 5vp for nickel priests, 6vp for dime priests.

Blood Coven, WereKittens, and Eldritch Cults are 3 completely different microgames in the world of Cults & Covens. Each game can be played by itself or the games can be mixed so that players can play vampire against cat, or 2 vampires, or 2 cats, or a mix of vampires and cats against a god from Eldritch Cults.

Crystal Taking is a trick-taking game. Players take turns playing cards to tricks in hopes of winning or losing tricks.

The game uses 56 minor arcana card, and 22 major. Minor arcana cards can be played right-side up to predict a victory or upside-down to predict defeat. The major arcana cards determine the rules for the round. There are typically three rule cards in play. You can pay VPs to put a new one from your hand into play (they each have 2 orientations also); the rules work as a conveyor, so when you add a new one, the oldest is removed.

After a certain number of rounds the game ends, leaving the player with the most points as the winner.

A coin from a legendary treasure has just appeared, proving that it is not a myth and only you can find it.

There were a lot of temples dedicated to worship the sun, but there was a special one from the Kalinasu civilization that worshiped the moon and housed a treasure full of coins made with a special metal that fell from the sky during the full moon. This is known as "The Treasure of Moon Gold", and a single piece of it would be worth millions. Your role will be to lead the search for the legendary treasure that was thought to be only a legend until a Professor found proof of its existence and a way to find it.

But you're not the only one who wants to get your hands on the treasure. An unknown group is chasing the professor and she has had no choice but to hide and flee, for that reason she has sent you, the best treasure hunter, everything you need to find the hidden temple where the legendary treasure awaits.

In this journey you will not be alone, the teacher's faithful assistant will accompany you wherever you need: in the heart of the jungle, in the middle of a desert or in the depths of the sea. He will always be ready to lend you a hand and get you out of trouble, although due to his clumsiness and his forgetfulness, it is likely

The adventure will be divided into 4 chapters. Each one will take place in a different part of the world with a totally different objective and tests that can be completed in an hour, like a traditional Escape Room. You can play them all at once or manage them in different days.

The root idea is simple: you’ve been dealt quite a handful, and your task is to empty your hand before your opponents do, matching the card atop the discard pile in face value or color. (Play one card per turn, and do what it says!)

Will you be the first person to play your last card? Be alert, because every card has stipulations, and the strategy increases with each expansion set of the game.

You’ll need your wits sharp and your attention undistracted, if you are to win. Good luck.

In the children's game for ages 4 and up, the players choose their medieval knight figure, each from a different era. The cards with the images of heads, bodies, legs, and arms lie face down in the center. Now the fun begins! What number does the die show? Is there a matching part for your own knight? If not, just give it to another player. The first player to finish the puzzle has won. But be careful! A robber baron has mingled with the knights in this exciting educational game. If the knight is completed first, everyone has lost together in this children's game.

This game (which could be translated to "Superhero Academy") is about Polish scientist that made a great impact in the history of science.

The game consist of 30 cards with a different scientist on each card. On a player's turn they draw a card from the pile and ask other players questions (which are actually clues) about the scientist (the questions are presented on the cards). The first player to guess which scientist the question(s) refer(s) to score 1-3 points depending on how many clue-questions they needed (more clues - less points).

The game ends when there are no cards in the pile and the player who scored the most points is the winner.

—user summary

Akademia Superbohaterów to fascynujÄ…ca rozgyrwka, która pozwala odkryÄ‡ znanych i nieznanych polskich bohaterów.

Gra karciana w formie quizu. Przeznaczona jest dla minimum dwóch graczy w wieku od 7 lat (gracze muszÄ… umieÄ‡ czytaÄ‡). Jej celem jest zgromadzenie jak najwiÄ™kszej liczby punktów.

Punkty sÄ… przyznawane za wiedzÄ™ o najwiÄ™kszych polskich naukowacach, a takÅ¼e za refleks.

—description from the back of the box

Based on the novel "Dog Mystery", a group of puppies have to stop BRAKO, an android dog who wants to usurp the role of animal death.

A board is built with tiles (5x5 for 2-3 players, or 6x6 for 4-5 players) where the skeletons of animals killed by BRAKO will be hidden.

The pups have 2 actions to perform each turn, they must choose between moving by rolling 1d6, removing a stone from the terrain, digging in a clear terrain. Resolve an event card and end turn.

BRAKO moves when events dictate, if he manages to completely damage a pup and they don't have a bone to heal it, the cubs loses.

If the pups manage to unearth the animal skeletons (4 in a 2-3 player game and 8 in a 4-5 player game) they will stop BRAKO and win the game.

Morgan le fay hast placed a curse over Camelot! There art four Arthurs seated at the round table. Three art changelings who've stolen the king's true form. Guinevere must find Merlin's crystals and send the imposters back to the faerie realm. But maketh haste, for the fabled knights art under the witch's spell and seek to destroyeth thee!

Crafty Croc has stolen all the eggs! Luckily, we have his swag bag. Can you return all the eggs to their correct nests?

Roll the dice! If you roll an egg, take the egg and place it in a nest. Will it hatch as a Chick or a Croc? If a chick, take a token...if a Croc, oh no! put the egg back in the bag.

Each player after their go, spins the nest! Can you remember where the croc hatched?

The first player to return all 3 baby chicks to the nest wins!

—description from the publisher

Search for hundreds of hidden illustrations in the Marvel Universe in Marvel: Eye Found It! while visiting Wakanda, Asgard, and everywhere in between on a large game board with your favorite Marvel characters.

A simple but fun board game,based on the famous TV series "The Dukes of Hazzard".  It was released in Greece in the 80's by Toys Art company. It can be played from 2-4 players. Each player in his turn rolls the spinner to determine how much spaces will he moves on the board. There is a unique space upon the spinner, which has the rule "Get a card". In that point, you must follow what card says. The winner is the player who reaches first the finish line.

—user summary

With Lilly through the year, you play in teams and learn about events of the year. 109 season cards show events and in addition a simple and a difficult question, the back has the answers. For a game, 20 random cards are placed ready. The active player chooses an easy or difficult question, rolls the appropriate die and moves Lili forward. If one can answer the question, the card goes out of the game, otherwise it goes under the pile. If Lilly passes over the call sign field, a new year begins. If the prepared pile is used up before 10 years have passed, everyone wins together.

—user summary

Throughout what is now known as Arizona, ancient civilizations constructed epic cities, harnessed the powerful and unpredictable rivers to water crops and sustain their communities, and thrived for thousands of years. Eventually, the unpredictability of the seasons, the power of the floods, and the fragility of infrastructure contributed to the abandonment of cities--leaving only ruins to mark these impressive achievements.

Today, modern technology and sheer hubris have resulted in a new set of settlements that again attempt to thrive in one of the world’s harshest and driest climates. With the help of modern engineering marvels like the Hoover Dam and the Central Arizona Project canal, more than 7 million people call Arizona home and over 100,000 more residents move there each year. How long can this continue before, like other civilizations of old, nature asserts its dominance and returns the cities to dust?

Watershed: Arizona is a turn-based asymmetrical game played in rounds. Each round consists of the following:
 1.    Revealing climate conditions card which modifies the precipitation coming to the watersheds
2.    Revealing and resolving policies that impact watershed conditions, city building and water infrastructure
3.    Simultaneous city building using workers and card playing
4.    Watershed stewardship and infrastructure building
5.    Delivering water to thirsty cities

Players will advance through eras that unlock new abilities, workers and actions—allowing the continued growth and development of their ambitious cities. Victory points determine the winner and are accumulated through achieving objectives, passing policies, stewarding watersheds, building districts and improving quality-of-life in cities, and conserving water through smart development practices.

Manufactured in the USA!

Countries race to be the first in the world to successfully test a nuke to prove their superiority. Players take on the roles of various weird countries in a fictitious world, sifting through junk piles to find parts to build their own nuclear missiles.

On each player's turn, the active player draws Junk cards according to the number their country allows, then checks to see if they have a set of cards according to their country's Set number (could be 2 or 3). If they have enough, they trade those cards in for a piece of their Nuke and bring that new piece into play immediately (even if the new piece is worse than their current piece).

Once a country has all 6 parts for their own Nuke, they test it. To test it, there is a die associated with each piece of the Nuke, starting at a 4-sided die, then a 6-, 8-, 10-, 12-, and finally a 20-sided die. Failure means the failing part is destroyed and the country must save up enough junk to replace it. If all parts test successfully, then STOP THE PRESSES, that country wins.

The shop was said to be minute and yet terrifying all at once. The patrons were both thrilled and horrified by what was inside. The very idea of man-eating plants! Well here we are, you and your shopkeeper friends have embarked on a truly hair-raising experience this time. Armed with your cloned assistants, just break the glass when you need a new one! And a cavalcade of customers ready to buy the most exotic plants, only the plants look awfully hungry. Ah, maybe we should rope off that area so no one gets too close?

Your goal: Gain the most points by being the most clever greenthumb!

Players will be using worker placement to feed the plants in the shop or add new plants to the shop in the form of dominoes. Players will stacking dominoes to create new levels with each level scoring for the greatest number of a value, with lower floors being hidden as the players stack, will they know what’s down below and plant those matching flowers in their greenhouses?

This tricky game of playing dominoes for the value and also stacking them gives players an elevated gaming experience. There’s also a dice customer or two each round who might visit the shop. Hopefully you can keep the man eating plants from doing what they do best! Or you may want to feed your opponents’ cloned shop assistants to the plants, but be aware that they also get the bonus you earn for doing so, while losing an assistant of course.

The game ends when the last domino makes it to the shop. Players score their greenhouses as multipliers with each level, maximizing their scores as they go.

After the big earthquake of 1755 that tore down Lisbon and most of Portugal's southern coast, it was necessary to rebuild an entire nation. The demand for window glass increased so much that William Stephens, a British businessman, saw the opportunity to expand his business in Portugal by investing in the glass industry.

In Stephens, players compete amongst one another in the role of master glassmakers working at the famous "Stephens" Factory to become the most prestigious figure in town...after Stephens, of course. Through clever and cunning planning, all players will develop their works, invest in new businesses, and promote the creation of jobs. Through a unique action-selection mechanism, on their turn players choose from a variety of options, either by activating the Stephens factory or by activating one of their personal investments.

The game ends when the Napoleonic forces arrive in town, at which time the player with the most prestige wins.

The race take place on a 6´x4´ flat surface where you place terrain and 5 point markers. You have to race thru the markers in order two times to win (two laps). At dispenser points you can get weapon, traps, shields a.s.o to use during the race.

Each turn you can do one of three things:


     Move: Move +D6”, pivot once by up to 90°, can use one item
     Drift: Move +D6”, pivot twice by up to 90°, can’t use any items
     Boost: Move +2D6”, pivot once by up to 45°, can’t use any items


First to finish two laps win.

When building traditional jigsaw puzzles, there are several tactics people use. One can look for pieces by their image or their shape.One can build the whole puzzle at the same time or concentrate on building a specific section of it. Organise the pieces before starting to build or dive right into it. Doing the border first, looking for a one of a kind piece and so on.

In Jigsuw, players need to master not only the different tactics to build a puzzle but also when to change from one to another. They start by setting down the large circular core of the puzzle flat on the table. From there, the players divide the rest of the pieces among themselves, then it’s off to the races. They compete to set down the pieces against the starting circle as fast as possible until the puzzle is complete.

What makes Jigsuw interactive is that players don’t just try to build the puzzle faster, but instead they need to try block their opponents. You block their pieces when you set down all surrounding ones before they get the chance to put theirs down. At this moment they cannot play it. The game continues until no one can lay down any pieces. Whoever ends the game with less pieces blocked wins the match.

Life at AFC Richmond isn't always simple, but Ted Lasso knows how to rally his team!

In Ted Lasso Party Game, you join Coach Lasso and Beard to show that you believe in Believe! Work together as a team to solve problems in each timed round, trying to play cards in the correct order and rolling a "football" die in the pitch — that is, the game box. If you ever get stuck, just break out the biscuits! This feel-good party game is all about having fun, the Lasso way!

—description from the publisher

It seems that new mines keep being discovered... But these mines aren't that big and all the dwarves will have to run to get the most out of them in just one day! In this dice version of Quartz, the bet remains the same: Everyone must explore the mine and sell the mined crystals in the city at the end of the day. The dwarf who manages to collect the most money will have the mine all to himself.

The game is divided into six rounds. On their turn each player must:
1. Mine a crystal:
The player draws a crystal from the bag and places it on his cart.
If the mined crystal is an unstable crystal, the player receives a
reroll marker. There is no limit to the number of reroll tokens a player can have.
2. Roll the dice:
Each player has up to three dice rolls per turn. In the first, all 5 dice must be rolled. In the second and third they can reroll as many dice as they want. If it has a Reroll Marker, the player can discard it to perform an extra reroll.
3. Perform actions:
According to the result of the dice the player will be able to perform one or more actions. The more faces of the same action are available, the more efficient that action will be. Actions allow the player to mine more crystals, steal crystals, store crystals in the chest, or transfer unstable crystals to opponents.

At the end of the game everyone receives points according to the value of the crystals they have, being entitled to bonus points for collections of equal crystals. Each unstable crystal will penalize its owner 3 points less and the player with the fewest crystals in the chest loses 5 points.

After midnight in Sleepy Hollow, the town comes to life with spooky sounds and creepy creatures!

In Disney Return of the Headless Horseman Game, Ichabod is frightened and needs your help! You have several chances to work together to get him to the covered bridge before the Headless Horseman heads him off...

—description from the publisher

In Word Radar Tantango, the players are the developers of a next next next generation communication tool, the read-your-mind-machine: Tantango. But! You must demonstrate the machine to the evaluation committee sponsoring your machine, despite knowing that the machine isn't ready at all! Try to cooperate with your teammates to avoid getting everyone fired.

The game takes place on a board which resembles a radar screen.  Players will be placing hint tokens at the coordinates of their individual preference along two axis which will be determined.  One player will be trying to guess the word which the other players are hinting at.

Players are dealt a number of cards showing words and a number of dry erase boards where they will write words that can be used as an axis label to determine where a word belongs. The players' word cards are collected and combined with some undealt cards.  From a public display of some of these cards, a specific one is chosen.  One player then chooses the two dry erase boards to label the axis.  Each player then places a token where they think the secret word fits in the two-dimensional grid.  Then, the player who was not shown the secret word attempts to guess it.  If they are correct, the team gets a point; if they are not correct, please be kind and remember you are a team.

The game includes a scoring table to evaluate your performance.

All mining dwarves in their early childhood already attended the greatest institution of teaching of mining techniques in the kingdom. Hands-on activities are part of the day-to-day lessons at the school, where young dwarves learn to distinguish precious crystals from worthless stones. The kid who gets the best set of crystal will receive the much-desired best student medal!

Starting with the youngest player and going clockwise, each player will explore the mine until they decide to leave and end their workday. When exploring the mine, the player draws a stone from the bag. Colored stones can be turned into medals. Two gray stones cause an accident that ends the workday. Ending the turn without having an accident grants the player two bonus medals. After everyone has explored the mine for three rounds, the game ends and players line up their acquired medals next to each other on the table. Whoever has the longest line of medals will be the winner.

The Traveling Cat Game is a board game with the goal of completing a world map from 108 tiles while moving a cat named Ricky from region to region.

Players work from an initial set of tiles that, like a puzzle, make up parts of the map. They continue to draw a tile at each turn, using the tiles to correctly build out the map, but only setting tiles in the regions where Ricky the Cat is currently visiting. Players can only move the cat to new regions based on their play. Some caution is required to ensure your tiles actually correspond with the country or land mass you intend to use them on. Knowledge of global maps or experience with puzzles is helpful.

The winner must get all their tiles onto the map first, and this is best accomplished by retaining tiles for strategic regions, passing or acting on certain opportunities, and, maintaining options to move Ricky the Cat when and where desired. After someone wins, the remaining players can continue the game to complete the global map competing with moves to use up their tiles soonest.

Enjoy this hilarious game at all your holiday parties. Your friends and family will love tossing the rings onto these inflatable antlers All ages will have a blast using this as an excuse to throw things at your head! Easily inflate the antlers and you are ready to play the game.

One person wears antlers that are inflated and the other players/teams toss inflatable red and green rings, trying to hook the rings over the antlers. Play until a certain score is reached (5 points for a short game, 20 for a long one).

To celebrate the 10th anniversary of the most popular Hangul boardgame Raon, Gemblo, inc. published Raon: 10th Anniversary.

It features deluxe components such as a velvet bag and golden color printed tiles. It has more tiles than the base game, so it can be played with up to five people. And the rule book includes total of twelve rules, from the first edition rules to the rules that are newly developed for this edition.

Examples of new rules included in 10th Anniversary edition:

Guess - Select a theme and each player makes a word related to the theme, then players figure out what words the other players made by guessing each consonant or vowel tile.

Connect - Players take turn making a word using their tiles. After the first player makes a word. The following players must use 1 syllable from ‘the previous word’ when they make a new word.

Recombine - This is the rules for Raon championship and any other tournaments.

Through 3 scenarios, with several levels of difficulty, the Escape Game settles in your living room. Hide the clues in your home, and above all, try to solve the riddles to save the world of the Ancient God in less than 60 minutes.

Two teams, one judge, over 400 crazy challenges and only 20 seconds to not get beat! In the 20 second challenge, players will have the opportunity to try their hand at completing a series of non-obvious, surprising and crazy tasks. The faster you tackle the challenge, the less time you leave for your rivals. An amazing party game that will make you laugh to tears!

Defend, defend and defend! Today you are facing the best team in the championship, you have been preparing for this event for long weeks by developing a tactic called The Mega Bus. You suffer but are well fielded in your half of the field, your players in the middle "Cut out" everything that passes and your defenders are well grouped in your area. As a last bastion, your goalkeeper resists, left, right, but begins to wear himself out... You have to hold on! It's up to you to achieve the perfect steering by making the most of your counterattacks?

Throughout the game, your objective will be to protect your goalkeeper's HP as much as possible from opposing attacks and penalties. For this you will play Defense, Middle, Recovery and Special cards. Attackers score goals when your goalkeeper has 0 PV left , but if you can resist attacks , you can counterattack by accumulating dice and score goals.

The game ends when the cards deck is empty and the winner is declared. You win by winning the match!!

Step off the stagecoach and into the cursed mining town of Tumbleweed in Disney Big Thunder Mountain Railroad. Will you find fortune mining the mysterious mountain — or awaken its many dangers? Each turn, resources spill down the mountain, with you trying to collect those resources to upgrade your mining operation to score more points. Each round features twist-of-fate cards that mess with the environment through dangers like landslides and dynamite.
